javadoc:
Utility class for managing the viewport in the {@link FVTable}. This viewport must be 
 adjusted manually whenever {@link Chunk} objects are added to or removed from to the view, 
 or whenever the {@link FVScrollBar} is moved.

methods.javadoc: @param viewport
methods.name: setViewport

methods.javadoc: @param table
methods.name: setTable

methods.javadoc: @param reader
methods.name: setReader

methods.javadoc: @param model
methods.name: setModel

methods.javadoc:
Returns the height (in pixels) of the viewport.
@return
methods.name: getHeight
methods.comment: Returns the height (in pixels) of the viewport.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the table row associated with the top of the viewport.
@return
methods.name: getViewportPositionAsRow
methods.comment: Returns the table row associated with the top of the viewport.

methods.name: isInViewport
methods.comment: Returns true if the given row is in the viewport.

methods.javadoc: Snaps the viewport to the bottom of the table.
methods.name: moveViewportToBottom
methods.comment: Snaps the viewport to the bottom of the table.

methods.javadoc: Snaps the viewport to the top of the table.
methods.name: moveViewportToTop
methods.comment: Snaps the viewport to the top of the table.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the number of rows that are visible in the viewport.
@return
methods.name: getNumRowsInViewport
methods.comment: Returns the number of rows that are visible in the viewport.

methods.javadoc:
Moves the viewport (top) to the given row in the current view.
@param row
methods.name: scrollViewportTo
methods.comment: Moves the viewport (top) to the given row in the current view.

methods.name: moveViewportUp
methods.comment:
Moves the viewport up the number of rows specified. If moving up puts he view above 
 the bounds of the first-visible chunk, load a previous chunk.

methods.name: moveViewportDown
methods.comment:
Moves the viewport down the number of rows specified. If moving down puts he view below 
 the bounds of the first-visible chunk, load the next chunk.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the first row in the viewport to be the start of the current selection range.  The 
 end of the selection range remains untouched.
methods.name: updateSelectionToViewportTop
methods.comment:
Sets the first row in the viewport to be the start of the current selection range.  The 
 end of the selection range remains untouched.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the last row in the viewport to be the end of the current selection range.  The 
 start of the selection range remains untouched.
methods.name: updateSelectionToViewportBottom
methods.comment:
Sets the last row in the viewport to be the end of the current selection range.  The 
 start of the selection range remains untouched.

methods.name: setPosition
methods.comment:
Sets the viewport to the given position, and fires off an event to notify any
 subscribers.

methods.name: getViewportOffset
methods.comment: Returns how many rows the given row is above or below the current viewport.

return.comment:
negative value if above the top of the viewport, positive value if below the bottom
         of the viewport, 0 if the line is already in the viewport.

methods.javadoc:
@param o
@param arg
methods.name: update

methods.javadoc:
Processes events received via the {@link FVEvent} mechanism.
@param event the event type received
methods.name: handleFVEvent
methods.comment: Processes events received via the FVEvent mechanism.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if all necessary state objects have been set.
@return
methods.name: isStateValid
methods.comment: Returns true if all necessary state objects have been set.

name: ViewportUtility
comment:
Utility class for managing the viewport in the FVTable. This viewport must be 
 adjusted manually whenever Chunk objects are added to or removed from to the view, 
 or whenever the FVScrollBar is moved.
